paper_abstract: We prove that the Variational distance (and its positive multiples) is the only f-divergence that satisfies both the identity of in-discernibles and the triangle inequality. Therefore it is the unique f-divergence which serves as a metric. This point is interpreted as a fundamental confliction of the convexity for f(x) with the metric properties for its associated f-divergence. Therefore, we relax the convexity of f(x) and replace it with other constraints to create new metrics.
paper_title: Confliction of the convexity and metric properties in f-divergences
